meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the blastopore.
meanings.sent1: The blastoporic structure was clearly visible under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Her research focused on the blastoporic development in amphibians.
meanings.sent3: The blastoporic pattern on the egg looked like a tiny maze.
meanings.sent4: The blastoporic features of the organism resembled intricate puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a colorful diagram to explain the blastoporic concept to the students.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the opening of the archenteron in the gastrula stage of embryonic development.
meanings.sent1: During the experiment, they observed the blastoporic opening in the embryo.
meanings.sent2: The blastoporic process is crucial for the formation of body cavities.
meanings.sent3: The blastoporic entrance seemed like a tiny door to a new world.
meanings.sent4: Her discovery shed light on the blastoporic gateway to development.
meanings.sent5: The textbook illustration vividly depicted the blastoporic structure in embryos.
